Hamilton star Miguel Cervantes has announced that his tragic three-year-old daughter Adelaide died on Saturday.

The actor broke the heartbreaking news three days after the youngster was placed in a hospice.

The 42-year-old confirmed that Adelaide had battled epilepsy and Infantile Spasms and lost her brave fight this weekend.

In a joint statement with his wife Kelly, the couple said: "The Cervantes family is heartbroken to announce that their baby girl Adelaide Grace tragically died early Saturday."

They said that Adelaide was "held in the loving arms of her family as she peacefully achieves the 'calm' for which they've been searching for so long."

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

The family added: "They would like to extend their deepest, heartfelt gratitude to all who have reached out with words of support and prayer and will continue to feel all the love as they go through this difficult time."

Kelly paid her own special tribute to her daughter, sharing an image of Adelaide's bedroom on Instagram .

"The machines are off. Her bed is empty. The quiet is deafening. Miss Adelaide Grace left us early Saturday morning," the grieving mother wrote.

"She came into the world and she had a mission and a story - I'm so proud that no one will ever forget her story."

(Image: Instagram)

"She went peacefully in surrounded by love," Kelly added. "Finally, she is free from pain, reactions and seizures but leaves our hearts shattered.

"We love you so much Adelaide bug and forever after."

Adelaide was days away from celebrating her fourth birthday. Ade
description: The family's "hearts are shattered" but they say they will never forget her brave fight for live
